title: COVID-19 Hub
description: Student Health Services has answers to your questions about COVID-19, including connections to on- and off-campus testing and vaccine resources. UC Riverside students can connect with SHS for the information you're seeking about COVID-19.
cleaned_text: Temporary Closure — Student Health Services Clinic Aug. 21 - Sept. 24 | [Laboratory Services](https://studenthealth.ucr.edu/laboratory) Aug. 28 - Sept. 11 | [Medical Services](https://studenthealth.ucr.edu/health-services) (includes imaging) Aug. 31 - Sept. 11 | [Pharmacy Services](https://studenthealth.ucr.edu/pharmacy) NurseLine (877) 351-3457 will continue to be available 24 hours a day, seven days a week during closure. COVID -19 Updates On May 25, 2023, the University of California announced revisions to the [University of California COVID-19 vaccine policy](https://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/news/2023/05/uc-updating-covid-19-vaccination-policy-to-systemwide-opt-out-program.html) in light of changes to state and federal COVID-19 public health guidance and the [end of the federal Public Health Emergency](https://www.hhs.gov/about/news/2023/05/09/fact-sheet-end-of-the-covid-19-public-health-emergency.html) on May 11, 2023. Effective immediately: - The University will require students to either receive COVID-19 vaccination or opt out by declination by filing an exemption each year in the UCR patient portal. - Students will no longer be required to submit documentation of a COVID-19 primary series or submit and receive an approved medical or religious exemption, or disability deferral to be present on campus. - Students will no longer have registration holds for COVID-19 vaccination. We ask for your patience as we transition to accommodate these new changes in Banner/R'Web and the UCR patient portal systems. [The Policy on Vaccination Programs](https://policy.ucop.edu/doc/5000695/VaccinationProgramsPolicy)—With Updated Interim Amendments will be revised to reflect these changes. We highly recommend the UCR community stay up to date with the most current [Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) COVID-19 Vaccination Recommendations](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html). We appreciate your ongoing efforts to protect your health and the health of our campus community. Clinic Updates COVID Screening Check UC Riverside students are required to fill out the COVID Screening Check to report: - A positive COVID-19 test result - Covid-19 symptoms (allergies and asthma are not considered COVID-19 symptoms for this report) - Exposed to someone who tested positive for COVID-19 (exposed is defined as close contact with a known person for more than 15 minutes in a 24 hour period) - Visit [screeningcheck.ucr.edu](https://ucriverside.az1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0pOB27zdrdkYxzE)to report - For more information visit Campus return [COVID Screening Check](https://campusreturn.ucr.edu/covid-screening-check) Resources and Contact Information Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Visit the CDC website for the latest COVID-19 fact sheets and guidance from the federal government, as well as access to vaccine and testing resources.
